intro: Trichodrymonia binata, commonly known as the two-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in inflorescences, which are typically surrounded by specialized structures called cyathia. Trichodrymonia binata is typically found in grasslands and rocky habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
